definitions.definition: A reduction in consumer cost (usually for a limited time) for items or services rendered; the thing thus sold.
examples: We're running a special on turkey for Thanksgiving.
I didn't have much money, so I bought the special .

definitions.definition: A meal offered only at a certain time by a restaurant , not as a standing fixture of the menu ; often, one of a rotation of meals systematically offered for a lower price ; also often a dish at a nondiscounted price that is seasonal or otherwise exciting or unusual.
examples: Today's dinner special is wild salmon, which we don't normally get a chance to offer.
The Tuesday lunch special is our tuna melt on rye.

definitions.definition: Unusual or exceptional episode of a series .
examples: Did you see the Christmas special ?

definitions.definition: Anything that is not according to normal practice, plan, or schedule, as an unscheduled run of transportation that is normally scheduled.
examples: Thousands came to see the special that carried the President's coffin.

definitions.definition: Any unlicensed medicine produced or obtained for a specific individual patient .
An award, typically a free game, that is made available to the player upon reaching or completing a major objective in a pinball game.
A journalist sent to the scene of an event to report back.
A dispatch sent back by a special correspondent.
A light that illuminates a specific person or thing on the stage.
A racehorse predicted to win; a sure thing .
